9701-d-02-28-97-WVRR.Narrative: AT 11:01 PM FEBRUARY 28, 1997, PERSON DRIVING A 1987 BMW SOUTHBOUND ON INDIANA STATE ROAD 121 ADJACENT TO THE WVRR YARDS, LEFT THE HIGHWAY AND CRASHED INTO STANDING COACH #2600.  A PASSENGER WAS THROWN INTO THE REAR SEAT AND WAS RESCUED BY A COUPLE PASSING BY.  THE CAR THEN BURST INTO FLAMES.  DRIVER DIED AT THE SCENE.  PASSENGER DIED MARCH 1, 1997 AT METHODIST HOSPITAL, INDIANAPOLIS, IN.  DRIVERWAS TESTED FOR ALCOHOL AND DRUGS.  HE HAD A BLOOD ALCOHOL CONTENT OF 0.268%.  HE ALSO HAD MARIJUANAIN HIS SYSTEM.  COACH #2600 SUSTAINED DAMAGE IN THE AMOUNT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4052-d-02-02-97-WC.Narrative: THE 2200 SWITCH CREW WAS PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES IN THE FOND DU LAC YARD WHEN THEY HAD PULLED TRACK 69 TO DOUBLE TO TRACK 57.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD CALLED THE YARDMASTER TO VERIFY THE REAR CAR ON THETRACK BEFORE SHOVING.  THE CAR WAS CONFIRMED AND THEY WERE TOLD TO PROCEED.  THEY WERE BEGINNING THEIR SHOVE WHEN CARS ON TRACK 57 ROLLED INTO THEIR TRAIN.  THE YARDMASTER HAD CONFIRMED THE WRONG CARDUE TO ONLY CHECKING THE INITIALS AND NOT THE NUMBERS ALSO.  HE HAD GIVEN THE CREW THE OKAY TO PROCEED WHICH CAUSED THIS CREW TO RUN INTO THEIR OWN TRAIN/SWITCHING MOVEMENT.  BESIDES THE TWO CARS THAT HAD DERAILED, TWO MORE CARS SUSTAINED DAMAGE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

0197-d-02-03-97-STMA.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW WAS SWITCHING THE PLYWOOD PLANT.  THEY HAD JUST PULLED LOADS FROM THE PLANT AND WERERE-SPOTTING WHEN THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED.  THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELING DOWN A 1.5 PERCENT GRADE WITH 5 EMPTIES LEADING, FOLLOWED BY A LOAD AND THE LOCOMOTIVE.  THE 5 EMPTY CARS HAD PASSED OVER THE CARNEYTRACK SWITCH.  THE LEAD WHEEL OF THE LOADED CAR CLIMBED OUT ON THE HIGH (RIGHT) SIDE AT THE SWITCH POINT AND CONTINUED FORWARD ON TOP OF THE RAIL TO THE HEEL BLOCK AND FELL INSIDE AND CONTINUED FORWARD TOWARD CARNEY ANOTHER 50 FEET UNTIL STOPPED BY THE LOCOMOTIVE.  IN THE DERAILMENT, THE LOADED CARDROPPED ABOUT 6 INCHES AND MOVED TO THE RIGHT ABOUT 40 INCHES BEFORE STOPPING.  THE COUPLERS BETWEENTHE LOAD AND 2ND CAR SLIPPED THE COUPLING.  DISCONNECTED, THE 5 LEADING CARS CONTINUED TO ROLL TOWARD THE PLYWOOD SHED.  UPON DISCOVERING THEY WERE FREE ROLLING TOWARD THE PLYWOOD PLANT, THE CONDUCTOR RIDING ON THE RIGHT SIDE ON THE LEAD CAR DISMOUNTED AND REMOUNTED THE SECOND CAR, ATTEMPTING TO SECURE A HAND BRAKE, BUT DISMOUNTED AT THE CROSSING PRIOR TO THE CARS ENTERING THE PLYWOOD PLANT.  THEBRAKEMAN, RIDING ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE LEAD CAR WAS UNABLE TO DISMOUNT DUE TO POOR FOOTING UNTILTHE CROSSING.  THE RUNAWAY CARS CONTINUED INTO THE PLYWOOD PLANT, HIT THE CLOSED REAR DOOR; CONTINUED ANOTHER 75 FEET TO THE END OF THE TRACK, CLIMBED UP A SNOW AND MUD PILE AND CAME TO REST ONE CAR LENGTH FARTHER ON TWO UNOCCUPIED COMPLEX EMPLOYEE AUTOMOBILES.  LOADED CAR MP 378002 LEAD WHEEL DERAI

97020177-d-02-13-97-SOO.Narrative: LITE ENGINES COLLIDED WITH INBOUND FORD HAULER ON THE NEW WESTBOUND TRACK AT ST PAUL YARD.  AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT, FORD HAULER WAS STANDING IN THE YARD UNATTENDED.  CREW OF TRAIN 575 CONSISTED OF A ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR, ON DUTY AT 0500 AT ST PAUL.  THE FORD HAULER WAS IN THE PROCESS OF CHANGING CREWS BY THE YARD OFFICE.  THE CREW CONSISTED OF A ENGINEER AND SWITCHMAN, ON DUTY AT 0630 AND WAS IN THE PROCESS OF GETTING ON THE FORD HAULER WHEN THE INCIDENT OCCURRED.  CONDUCTOR OF TRAIN 575ADVISED HE WAS TAKING 575'S POWER OUT OF THE DIESEL SHOP TO GET ON THEIR TRAIN, THEY CAME OFF THE DIESEL HOUSE TRACK AND HE LOOKED AND IT APPEARED TO BE LINED FOR THE 21 POCKET TRACK WHICH WAS CLEAR.CONDUCTOR OF TRAIN 575 FURTHER STATED THAT HE GOT OFF THE DIESEL HOUSE SWITCH AND WATCHED THE CONSIST COMING BACK.  THE CONSIST INVOLVED HAD FIVE LOCOMOTIVES; FROM THE WEST, THE LEAD CONTROLLING UNITCP 5903; HATX 751; CP 5864; CSXT 7570 AND REAR EAST UNIT SOO 6611.  CONDUCTOR OF TRAIN 575 STATED HE THEN HEARD A NOISE AND HE STOPPED THE MOVEMENT WHICH HE ESTIMATED SPEED TO BE 3 MPH.  HE THEN OBSERVED THAT THE CROSSOVER SWITCH TO THE NEW WESTBOUND WAS LINED FOR THE CROSSOVER RATHER THAN FOR THE21 POCKET AND SAW THE REAR UNIT SOO 6611 HAD COLLIDED WITH AND DAMAGED TWO CARS WHICH WERE ON THE FORD HAULER, GTW 306545 AND CNA 798322, TWO EMPTY PARTS CARS.  ENGINEER OF TRAIN 575 STATED THAT THEYWERE OPERATING ON RADIO AND DUE TO THE TRACK CURVATURE AND DISTANCE, HE WAS UNABLE TO SEE THE SWITCH

AFTER NOTIFYING THE BN DISPATCHER AND THE BN YARDMASTER ABOUT HANDLING THE INTERCHANGE, OUR CREW NOTIFIED THE BN CREW THAT OUR CONDUCTOR HAD NO BN RADIO CHANNEL.  SOO AND BN CONDUCTORS MET AT THE AMTRAK CROSSING.  BN CREW ADVISED SOO CONDUCTOR TO PROTECT THEAMTRAK CROSSING ON THE SHOVE MOVE AND THEY WOULD LINE EVERYTHING UP.  ENGINEER WAS CALLED BY BN CREW TO START BACKING UP.  SOO ENGINEER ASKED THE BN CREW IF EVERYTHING WAS LINED AND BN CREW RESPONDEDTHAT ALL WAS LINED AND SIGNALS FAVORABLE FOR THE SHOVE MOVEMENT.  SOO TRAIN WENT 20 CAR LENGTHS WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  SOO CONDUCTOR WALKED TOWARDS THE HEAD END OF TRAIN AFTER HEARING AIR GO.  SOO ENGINEER CALLED BN CREW AND ADVISED THE TRAIN WAS ON THE GROUND.  ELEVEN CARS WERE DERAILED DUE TO FAILURE OF BN CREW TO REMOVE DERAIL FOR SOO TRAIN.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

FEB97-d-02-06-97-ATLT.Narrative: ON FEB 6, 1997, A T & L RAILROAD HAD A TRAIN AND CREW DEPART WATONGA, OKLAHOMA DESTINED FOR CALUMET,OKLAHOMA. TRAIN CONSISTED OF 3 LOCOMOTIVES, 50 CARS LOADS OF WHEAT AND ONE EMPTY HOPPER CAR. AT APPROXIMATELY 11:15 AM THE MANAGER RECEIVED A CALL BY TELEPHONE AT HIS OFFICE FROM THE TRAIN CREW. THEENGINEER TOLD HIM THAT THERE WERE SOME CARS DERAILED AT MP 4.1. WHEN THE MANAGER ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION, THE CONDUCTOR WAS WALKING BACK FROM THE LOCOMOTIVES. THEY DISCUSSED WHAT HAD HAPPENED AND HE SAID THAT THEY FELT THE LOCOMOTIVES PULL DOWN AND THEN SHOVE FORWARD REAL QUICK. AT THAT POINT THE ENGINEER APPLIED THE EMERGENCY BRAKES. WHEN THEY STOPPED THEY LOOKED AND SAW SOME CARS DERAILED. UPONINVESTIGATING THE SCENE AND TRACK STRUCTURE, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAUSE WAS A BROKEN RAIL.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

97023-d-02-28-97-ARR.Narrative: WHILE SPOTTING CARS TO SLIP #1 TRACK IN A SHOVING MOVE, BRAKEMAN INSTRUCTED ENGINEER TO PROCEED 7 CARS TO A STOP. AFTER CHANGING RADIOS, BRAKEMAN INSTRUCTED ENGINEER TO STOP MOVEMENT. ENGINEER DID NOTHEAR RADIO TRANSMISSION AND SHOVED BEYOND POINT MOVEMENT WAS TO STOP. CUT OF CARS WAS SHOVED ONTO THE BARGE SLIP THAT COULD NOT SUPPORT THE WEIGHT WITHOUT A BARGE PRESENT. THE BARGE SLIP COLLAPSED CAUSING 2 CARS TO FALL INTO THE BAY. LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER FAILED TO STOP THE MOVE AT ONE-HALF THE 7 CARS DISTANCE WHEN HE DID NOT HEAR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE BRAKEMAN IN VIOLATION OF ARRC RULE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
